Saw the above in the .log.  Not sure what exactly I was doing at the time.

Created an attachment (id=12521)
Complete log

Here's my complete log.
It happens at startup, and is reproduceable with my workspace (it happened
again just now when I restarted).  The other exception here is for bug 67875
and is unrelated.

Not sure why the CVS console is getting activated.
My workspace comes up in the Java perspective with the Package Explorer active
at the left, Error Log view frontmost in the group at bottom, and with a plain
text editor open.  The Console view is in the bottom group, so is not active.

I do have decorators on, and they are showing in the Package Explorer.

If I switch to the console view, it has the CVS page showing, but there is no
content.
I'm getting the exception with this build as well...

This is caused by the repositoriesView.xml file being loaded on startup after 
the CVS console is initialize. The CVS console initialization is causing an 
asyncExec to occur which tries to load CVSUI classes from another thread. In 
this case, the console is fine (it is empty for Nick because he has not run a 
CVS command that outputs to the console since startup). The only negative side 
effect is the log entry which we feel is not enough justification for 
inclusion in 3.0 at this stage.

Yep, I get exactly this as well in RC3.  It's a bit annoying to see a 
virgin .log file besmirched like this...  ;-)

Turning off "Team->CVS->Console->Show CVS Output in the Console View" stops 
the error message being generated.

Are you sure you don't want to fix this for RC4?

PB

I get this too in 3.0RC3. Was going to report it but found this was already 
reported.
*** Bug 68595 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 68589 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 69109 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I've have released the fix to 3.0.1 but still need to merge with HEAD.
Fix also released to HEAD
*** Bug 70705 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

There is still a hole whereby the user could be prompted twice for the 
password for a repository location. It is simple to fix so 'd like to consider 
it for 3.0.1.

The hole I mentioned involves two places (e.g. executing command and 
repository view) that add a repository to the list of known repositories. This 
can only occur is somehow the repository is not stored in the preferences. I 
couldn't see where that could occur but it did once (I have not been able to 
reproduce yet).

What happens is that one place creates a repository location but does not add 
it the list of known locations right away (there a valid reasons for this). 
The other place then adds the location to the list and connects. The first 
place then tries to connect but does not have the proper authentication 
information so a reprompt occurs.

The solution I have released to 3.1 involved CVSRepositoryLocation. Basically 
I test to see if the location being connected with is known but is not the 
same instance that is cahced. In this case, the authentication information is 
copied from the cahced instance when attempting to open a connection and 
copied back to the cahce if the information was changed while connecting.

Given that the change is a bit involved and I have only seen the problem once 
(it is the same code in 3.0.1 and 3.1), I am hesitant to suggest submitting it 
to 3.0.1. I will perform more testing around this (involving upgrades from 
2.x) and see if I can reproduce the failure. If I do, we can consider whether 
we ned to release more code for this to 3.0.1.
We've done all we're going to do in 3.0.1 for this.
verfied in rc2
*** Bug 74053 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
